intro: Hieracium legiourbionicum, commonly known as the rare and elusive legiourbionic hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in moist, grassy habitats and is often found in meadows or along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in several countries.
